Title: The journey to controlling external monitors on M1 Macs
Description: When M1 Macs were launched, a new GPU with iOS-like architecture started driving the external monitors. Title: Facial expression software knows which Olympic medal makes you happier and why

Title: How to create a standalone ConsoleLoggerProvider
Description: If, for whatever reason you want to create a stand alone instance of ConsoleLoggerProvider without having to leverage dependency injection and the full Hosting framework, you‚Äôll find that the ConsoleLoggerProvider‚Äôs constructor requires an instance of an IOptionsMonitor<T>, the only instance of which OptionsMonitor<T> in turn has a complex constructor with many dependencies. This all seems like a failure of design on Microsoft‚Äôs part. Here I give a simple no-op IOptionsMonitor<T> implementation to allow one to easily create a ConsoleLoggerProvider.
